#include "DefaultCommandHandler.h"

Functions

CommandHandler * createCommandHandlerObject ()
 Entry points in the shared object to deal with name-mangling, creates a DefaultCommandHanlder object and returns it.
bool destroyCommandHandlerObject (CommandHandler *&obj)
 Entry point in the dll to destroy the object, attempts to downcast the object to the correct type (in this case, a DefaultCommandHanlder) and then delete it using the appropriate destructor.

Function Documentation

CommandHandler* createCommandHandlerObject (  ) 

Entry points in the shared object to deal with name-mangling, creates a DefaultCommandHanlder object and returns it.

Don't forget to cast the object to the right type before deleting the name must remain the same, so the server can always look up the right symbol This means you can't have two handler libraries loaded at the same time, because the symbols would conflict.

bool destroyCommandHandlerObject ( CommandHandler *&  obj  ) 

Entry point in the dll to destroy the object, attempts to downcast the object to the correct type (in this case, a DefaultCommandHanlder) and then delete it using the appropriate destructor.
